required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Peer Navigation to Link Released HIV+ Jail Inmates to HIV Care
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Peer Navigation to Link Released HIV+ Jail Inmates to HIV Care

collaborator.agency: Los Angeles County Department of Public Health

brief_summary.textblock: This study will implement a peer navigation intervention to improve linkage to and retention in HIV care for inmates released from L.A. county jail into the community.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Number of HIV+ ex jail inmates accessing HIV care
This assesses whether or not the HIV+ ex jail inmates were retained in their HIV care after first accessing care.
How adherent the HIV+ ex jail inmates are to their treatment regiment, by self-report.
HIV+ ex jail inmates' viral load

secondary_outcome.description: Cost of the intervention and HIV care

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive the following peer navigation services: 1) 10 Navigator meetings: Navigators will meet with participants in person to teach linkage/retention skills and knowledge 2a) 2 Navigator accompaniment sessions: the peer navigator will accompany participants to HIV care appointment. Before and after the appointment, participants and navigators will review linkage and retention skills/knowledge and things that make it hard or easy for him/her to get regular HIV care 2b) Optional peer navigator accompaniment sessions: If the participant requests, the peer navigator will provide accompaniment to supportive HIV care appointments (one per month max) 3) 14 peer navigator care calls: During these calls, navigators and participants will talk about any problems that could make it difficult to get regular HIV care.
Participants assigned to the control arm will receive the transitional case management (TCM) services that are currently offered at the jail

intervention.description: Peer navigation intervention to improve linkage to and retention in HIV care and suppress viral load for underserved HIV+ persons in Los Angeles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Age 18 or older
- Men or TGW diagnosed HIV-positive
- English or bilingual Spanish speaking
- Selected for the TCM program (control condition) prior to LINK LA enrollment
- Residing in LA County upon release
- Eligible for ART or incarcerated on ART.
Exclusion criteria:
- Inability to give informed consent
- Parole hold or planned transfer to prison
- Stay in jail <5 days.
